weeklyEmail.teaser: Official email from the UT Austin Chapter of the Society of Physics Students

item.name: Grad Student Panel
item.info: Tonight, we'll have several graduate students from around the department coming to answer questions about research, grad school (and applications), and more! Hope to see you there!

item.name: Natural Sciences Week
item.info: ATTENTION ALL CNS STUDENTS! Get excited, Natural Sciences Week is October 14th-18th this year. They've got a great lineup of events. Please come out to everything and anything that interests you! There will be FREE food, t-shirts, and much more at EVERY EVENT. Info is available on a poster near you (in RLM at least) and online here.

item.name: Jean Holloway Award for Teaching Excellence
item.info: Have a professor who goes above and beyond in the College of Natural Sciences or College of Liberal Arts? Nominate him or her for the Texas Exes' Jean Holloway Award for Teaching Excellence! UT students nominate professors using the online form, then a selection committee of your fellow students selects the winner based on nomination forms and class visits. The award is very prestigious (since it comes from students) and can be a turning point for a newer professor trying new things or a welcomed reward to a professor who has his or her own working formula.

item.name: T-shirt Ordering
item.info: For the first time, we will be conducting t-shirt sales online! Check out our website at http://www.ph.utexas.edu/~sps/pages/tshirts.html, where you can order via PayPal thanks to our webmaster, Tharon Morrison. We will also be in the RLM lobby selling shirts in the next couple weeks to sell our remaining inventory and take pre-orders. We'll be updating the graphics shortly to reflect the colors that were voted on last week (results viewable here). Questions? Email us!

item.name: Student-Led Spring PHY 110C Courses
item.info: It's official! The Department of Physics is offering two student-led courses next semester as PHY 110C! Unique ID 58911 is with SPS President, Evan Ott, and LaTeX master Will Beason who will be leading an "Introduction to Data Analysis for Physics" course, geared as preparation for PHY 355L (Modern Lab / Junior Lab) with LaTeX and Mathematica. Unique ID 58913 is going to be led by Crystal Riley, on an "Introduction to Programming for Physics" using Python, geared to introduce you to concepts in programming that you can then apply in research or industry. Neither course presumes prior programming experience. For scheduling info, consult the Course Schedule, and for other questions, email us at spsofficers@gmail.com.

item.name: Open House Poster Contest!
item.info: November 4th is the 2013 Annual Physics Department Open House, which means several things for you! First, if you have done research, you can submit a poster to the Open House Poster Contest! There will be prizes for the top posters as judged by a panel. Think you might be up to the challenge? Fill out this form to let us know! Check out links on the form for more details. We want a full list of posters in early October, so that they will be ready to print in late October. Questions? Email us! (link below).

item.name: Open House Volunteering!
item.info: November 4th is the 2013 Annual Physics Department Open House and SPS is looking for a ton of people to help make this event a success. If you are not submitting a poster, but would still like to help out, you can sign up to be a volunteer. Volunteers will be greeting visitors and answering questions, selling t-shirts, and directing visitors to labs, elevators, and posters. You will also get Sigma Pi Sigma service hours for this event, so please sign up here! In the coming weeks we will also need people to put up fliers to promote the event, so keep that in mind. If you have any questions, feel free to email us!

item.name: Student-Led Seminars
item.info: This was the third week of SPS student-led classes. Arduino Scouts can handle approximately 10 more people. If you want to learn the basics of how to build a robot, this class is for you. Email Jules for more info at julespeak@gmail.com (meets Mondays from 5-7pm). The machine shop classes will be getting down and dirty this following week so if you want to see if you can squeeze your way into the roster then email Gabe at gcossio14@utexas.edu for more information (meets 8-10am M and W, 8-9:30am TTh). Lastly, C++ is also looking for more people to learn the basics of scientific programming. Email douglasdavis@utexas.edu for more info (meets Mondays from 6-7pm).

item.name: Soccer Payment Reminder
item.info: IM Soccer registration is over, but if you signed up, we need you to pay your part of the registration fee. If this pertains to you, contact SPS Vice-President, Gabriel Cossio at gcossio14@utexas.edu or SPS Outreach Coordinator, Courtney Campion at ccampion@utexas.edu

item.name: Mentoring Groups
item.info: If you are interested in being mentored please sign up and get your friends to sign up too! You can sign up here to be a mentee and here to be a mentor. Email SPS Webmaster, Tharon Morrison at t_morrison@utexas.edu for more information.

item.name: League of Legends Tournament/LAN Party
item.info: Do you play LoL (League of Legends)? Want to play with some of your fellow physicists? SPS is hoping to host a LAN party / tournament of sorts in the near future. If you're interested, you can sign up here and view results (other player's names, summoner names, etc.) here email SPS Webmaster, Tharon Morrison at t_morrison@utexas.edu

item.name: Sunday Night Study Session
item.info: It's back! Our Sunday Night Study Session (SNSS) is in full swing! For those who haven't been, every week we invite any and all physics majors and people in physics or math classes to come by to work on homework. With many upper-division students in attendance (and some LAs for classes), when you run into problems, you won't be stuck for long. We also provide cookies, coffee, tea, etc., to help keep you <s>caffeinated</s> energized. Some come by to help or be helped! If you're interested in tutoring, making known that you're available during the night (name on a chalkboard) is a great way to earn service hours for Sigma Pi Sigma.

item.name: Service Hours
item.info: Interested in joining Sigma Pi Sigma, the physics honors society? The requirements are listed on our website. For the service hour component, we will be managing that through the new HornsLink system (see below for the link). Join the SPS group and when you volunteer (like tutoring for SNSS above), submit a request for us to verify your service hours. That way, we have a nice record of volunteers and volunteer time (and it will show up on the resume HornsLink can create for you)! You input the time you worked, we sign off, then you don't have to think about it again!

item.name: Comments or Questions
item.info: Have something to complain about? Or a question? Maybe an idea for a meeting or event? Or suggestions about how we use technology? Contact us at spsofficers@gmail.com or see the links below! As always, Don't Forget To Be Awesome!
